definition: to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless

sentences.english: They resorted to the trick of passing off fish-eyes as pearls.
sentences.chinese: 他们使用了鱼目混珠的伎俩。

sentences.english: The peddler fobbed off pieces of glass as diamonds.
sentences.chinese: 这小贩鱼目混珠，以玻璃充当钻石骗人。

sentences.english: These facts prove that they are trying to pass fish eyes for pearls.
sentences.chinese: 这些事实证明他们是在打算鱼目混珠。

definition: lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group
lit. fish and dragons mixed in together (idiom); fig. crooks mixed in with the honest folk
hard to distinguish real from imitation
lit. to hang a sheep's head while selling dog meat (idiom)/fig. to cheat/dishonest advertising/wicked deeds carried out under banner of virtue
pinyin: gua4 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4

definition: lit. to steal a rafter and replace it with a column/to replace the original with a fake/to perpetrate a fraud (idiom)
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain/also written 渾水摸魚|浑水摸鱼
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
lit. to drill a hole/to take advantage of a loophole/to exploit an advantage/to seize the opportunity (esp. to do sth bad)
